criticals.name: Manifest Debug
criticals.description: The application is in debug mode. This allows any malicious person to inject arbitrary code in the application. This option should only be used while in development.
criticals.code:
<uses-sdk android:targetSdkVersion="23" android:minSdkVersion="15" />
  <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE" />
  <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE" />
  <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.INTERNET" />
  <application android:icon="@jakhar.aseem.diva:mipmap/ic_launcher" android:debuggable="true" android:supportsRtl="true" android:theme="@jakhar.aseem.diva:style/AppTheme" android:allowBackup="true" android:label="@jakhar.aseem.diva:string/app_name">
    <activity android:theme="@jakhar.aseem.diva:style/AppTheme.NoActionBar" android:label="@jakhar.aseem.diva:string/app_name" android:name="jakhar.aseem.diva.MainActivity">
      <intent-filter>
        <action android:name="android.intent.action.MAIN" />
        <category android:name="android.intent.category.LAUNCHER" />

criticals.name: SQL injection
criticals.description: This application is vulnerable to SQL injection. Any data stored in database can be exposed as any attacker is able to retrive, modify and delete the stored information.

criticals.name: SQL injection
criticals.description: This application is vulnerable to SQL injection. Any data stored in database can be exposed as any attacker is able to retrive, modify and delete the stored information.

highs.name: Temp File Use
highs.description: Applications is creating temp files. Sensitive information should never be written in temp files.

highs.name: Write-Read in external storage
highs.description: Application can read/write in external storage. Any app can read data written in external storage.

mediums.name: Allows Backup
mediums.description: This option allows backups of the application data via adb. Malicious people with physical access could use adb to get private data of your app into their PC.
mediums.code:
<uses-sdk android:targetSdkVersion="23" android:minSdkVersion="15" />
  <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE" />
  <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE" />
  <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.INTERNET" />
  <application android:icon="@jakhar.aseem.diva:mipmap/ic_launcher" android:debuggable="true" android:supportsRtl="true" android:theme="@jakhar.aseem.diva:style/AppTheme" android:allowBackup="true" android:label="@jakhar.aseem.diva:string/app_name">
    <activity android:theme="@jakhar.aseem.diva:style/AppTheme.NoActionBar" android:label="@jakhar.aseem.diva:string/app_name" android:name="jakhar.aseem.diva.MainActivity">
      <intent-filter>
        <action android:name="android.intent.action.MAIN" />
        <category android:name="android.intent.category.LAUNCHER" />

warnings.name: Internet permission
warnings.description: Allows the app to create network sockets and use custom network protocols. The browser and other applications provide means to send data to the internet, so this permission is not required to send data to the internet. Check if the permission is actually needed.
warnings.code:
<manifest xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android" platformBuildVersionCode="23" android:versionName="1.0" platformBuildVersionName="6.0-2166767" android:versionCode="1" package="jakhar.aseem.diva">
  <uses-sdk android:targetSdkVersion="23" android:minSdkVersion="15" />
  <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE" />
  <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE" />
  <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.INTERNET" />
  <application android:icon="@jakhar.aseem.diva:mipmap/ic_launcher" android:debuggable="true" android:supportsRtl="true" android:theme="@jakhar.aseem.diva:style/AppTheme" android:allowBackup="true" android:label="@jakhar.aseem.diva:string/app_name">
    <activity android:theme="@jakhar.aseem.diva:style/AppTheme.NoActionBar" android:label="@jakhar.aseem.diva:string/app_name" android:name="jakhar.aseem.diva.MainActivity">
      <intent-filter>
        <action android:name="android.intent.action.MAIN" />

warnings.name: Read external storage permission

warnings.name: URL Disclosure
warnings.description: The decompilation of the source code could lead to the disclosure of private URLs.

warnings.name: Write external storage permission
warnings.description: Allows the app to write to the SD card. Check if the permission is actually needed.
warnings.code:
